title: Change "Turrets Destroyed" to "Damage Done to Objectives"
body:
Title pretty much sums it up. Turret Kills (on the post-game recap) shouldn't go to any single individual; they're usually a group effort.
"Inhibitors Destroyed" is similarly useless. "Damage Done to Objectives" would be better, representing damage done to Towers, Inhibitors, Dragons, Baron, and the enemy Nexus. It could be split into "Damage Done to Epic Monsters" and "Damage Done to Structures", which would also work well.

Either way you try to slice it this stat will always be misleading.

The stat wouldn't be misleading, it's misleading now.  Seriously, you can have a game with 8 inhibitors destroyed on one side with only 2 towers credited to players.  How is that any less misleading than this suggestion?

If the ADC does the most damage to structures then the ADC did the most damage and deserves credit for it.  If the ADC was busy focusing on enemy champs and your top laner did the most damage to structures then they deserve credit for it.  But right now, if the top laner focuses on stuctures and the ADC runs up to last hit (because of that higher damage output) they can take credit for several tower kills while doing nearly no damage to them.

I think it'd be pretty damned straight forward to say that counting damage done to structures since we already count damage done to champions and damage done overall by each champion.

But a lot of the times the ADC wouldn't have been able to do that much damage to turrets if they didn't have their team with them either. It's not like the ADC was alone the entire time.

Hello o/

Would it be possible to swap the "Damage Taken" and "Self-mitigated damage" numbers to something along the lines of "Raw Damage Taken" which would be the sum of the two? If the ADC took 10K and self-mitigated 3K, while the Tank took also 10K but self-mitigated 15K, that's really the sum of the two that is meaningful: the ADC suffered 13K damage, while the Tank absorbed 25K that wasn't directed at their backline.

Thank you :)

Another stat I would like to see would be "Damage mitigated" This would include buffing ally's resistances, shielding, basically anything that keeps allies from taking damage that isn't like, Wind Wall, body blocking, or healing, though if you really wanted to you could also include self mitigation like Wind Wall, your total defenses, or Braum's Unbreakable. I think it's more representative of how much tanks and shield heavy champions actually contribute, because I've had games as Taric (pre rework) against very AD heavy teams where I take almost full aggro in late game fights and take borderline laughable damage because I just had so many resistances, and in the post game 3 teammates took more damage than me because I simply reduced so much damage instead of actually taking it. 

This would also benefit supports like Sona and Janna who aren't healing focused and instead rely on mitigating damage with shields more so than healing actual wounds (though Janna and Sona can both heal decent amounts. Would probably be better for say, Thresh or Blitzcrank who don't have actual heals). And since it wouldn't just be something like "Shields applied to allies" it would only count the damage that the shield would absorb, meaning that timing shields to block heavy instances of damage contributes a lot while just shielding allies at random wouldn't really do anything, this way it would accurately show how much damage you kept yourself and allies from taking since a shield that blocks nothing at all isn't really helping anybody (The exception being Black Shield stopping CC from abilities that deal physical damage, but CC is not damage, I have no idea how to properly credit that one).

Honestly, both as a base concept and especially with the LoL community;

All our stats and the like just shouldn't be available for others to see at all.

Nobody else should be able to check your match history, only you should be able to check how much damage you did after the match, etc. etc. etc.

Our stats and information should be private.

As for the towers, being that it's an objective of the match, it really isn't necessary to specify who toppled it, just say it went down.

North korea and trump agree with you. 

Though from a competitive point of view that is just silly, having damage numbers but not being able to compare it to other people in the same game or even a different game would make it hard to see where your strengths and weaknesses are on a given champ.

What should be provided is averages and/or normal values. Perhaps also the record.
That way you could compare yourself to most everyone else that plays that champ in/or that role, without anybody's information being revealed. 

I don't even know my own stats, I've never worried or cared about them, I just play one match at a time. But it really irks me to know that random strangers can look at my information without my permission.
